repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: Martin K. Gordon collection
did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site, and may require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection is made up of the research files of Martin K. Gordon for the hearings on Riots, Civil and Criminal Disorders of the Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations of the Committee on Government Operations. The committee was investigating the protests and civil unrest that developed in the late 1960s and early 1970s. The collection includes articles from periodicals and journals, congressional committee transcripts and bibliographic materials. The documents date from 1955 to 1976 with the bulk being from 1968 to 1976.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into 4 series: Articles and Papers, Congressional Transcripts and Related Materials, Bibliographic Materials, and Ephemera.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Martin K. Gordon, July 7, 1988.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

did.unittitle: Articles and papers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials in this series are from periodicals as well as published and unpublished articles by scholars. They date from 1969-1976 with the bulk being from the period 1969-1970. They consist of an academic and journalistic look at the student unrest of the late 1960s and early 1970s. They are organized chronologically and include materials on general as well as specific topics.

Congressional transcripts and related materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of congressional transcripts dating from 1969-1971 and two indicies of publications of the Committee on Un-American Activities from 1938-1968. Most transcripts originally found in this collection have been removed because they are available electronically. Some reports especially those related to the Black Panther Party were retained due to the potentially difficulty in retrieving them from another source.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contain the various list of sources related to campus and community unrest that Gordon collected between 1967 and 1970.
